intro: Rubus thyrsoideus var. eupersicinus, commonly known as the red-berried blackberry, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a deep red color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
